docs.snippet: Video of the pickax killing — and the killer’s rants about Muslim men who lure Hindu girls — spread across India, reopening sectarian wounds.

headline.print_headline: Filmed Killing Of Muslim Goes Viral, Rattling India
headline.main: His Defense of Hindus Was to Kill a Muslim and Post the Video

Inmates are barred from reading titles from best-selling publications to the obscure because they run afoul of prison guidelines, like having graphic sexual content.

headline.print_headline: Texas Prisons Ban 10,000 Books. No ‘Charlie Brown Christmas’ for Inmates.
headline.main: Texas Prisons Ban 10,000 Books. No ‘Charlie Brown Christmas’ for Inmates.

docs.snippet: Advertisements promoting an exhibition in Vienna to mark 100 years since the painter’s death were rejected in Britain and Germany as too graphic.

headline.print_headline: Dead for a Century, But Still Causing a Stir
headline.main: Egon Schiele Is Still Too Racy for Some, Nearly 100 Years After His Death

docs.snippet: In his first college appearance since the violence in Charlottesville, Va., the white supremacist and his supporters were outnumbered by students and others protesting his views.

headline.print_headline: Protesters Drown Out Richard Spencer at University of Florida
headline.main: Protesters Drown Out Richard Spencer at University of Florida

docs.snippet: The golden age of television isn’t always so shiny.

docs.snippet: Treat yourself to some fried chicken, paired with whatever you’d like, whether cream gravy and mashed potatoes, or braised greens.

In 1977, Nathan Farb, a left-leaning Jewish artist, was chosen by the government to represent the United States on a public relations trip to the Soviet Union, where he took portraits of Novosibirsk citizens.

headline.main: Those Soviets, They’re Not So Different From Us

docs.abstract: In 1977, Nathan Farb, a left-leaning Jewish artist, was chosen by the government to represent the United States on a public relations trip to the Soviet Union, where he took portraits of Novosibirsk citizens.
